answers.answer: I was told by my doctor I have this too n did ur doctor tell you any risk during labor

I had gestational diabetes with my first baby and have it with this baby as well.  My first baby was fine and I was too.  When the baby is born they will monitor their glucose because some babies can have a hard time regulating their sugar after birth.  They may also give baby oxygen to help with breathing that doesn't mean anything's wrong it just helps baby.  My labor and delivery was normal.  I'm sure yours will be too!

As long as you're keeping you blood sugar under control you can have a normal pregnancy with no issues.  However most doctors won't let you go past your due date so expect your doctor to bring up induction if you haven't gone into labor by 39 weeks.
Thanks ladies...hoping for a good labor..

question: So as I'm getting closer to my due date has anybody had any complications during labor or after birth...caused by gestational diabetes
title: closer to due date with gestational diabetes
